conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows from A to the right.
Liquid from A encounters a baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid from A continues downward and flows into container D.
Liquid flows from B to the left.
Liquid from B encounters a baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid from B continues downward and flows into container E.
Liquid flows from C to the left.
Liquid from C encounters a baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid from C continues downward and flows into container E.
Liquid from A flows into container D; liquid from B and C flows into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container D, and liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
